articles.title: Kim Jong Il Provides Guidance to State Academy of Sciences
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Provides Guidance to State Academy of Sciences
Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il provided field guidance to the Bioengineering Branch of the State Academy of Sciences making a leap forward to push back the frontiers of latest science and technology.
					 He went round for hours the Exhibition of Scientific Research Achievements, room for production and introduction of intermediary process of biological products, genome research room, plant tissue culture room, stem cell research room, gene transferable plant research room and other places of the branch to acquaint himself in detail with scientific researches.
					
					 It is a great success that the scientists and technicians of the branch clarified the cause of various contagious diseases by a bioengineering method, developed medicines and vaccines good for curing incurable diseases, he said, appreciating their spirit of devoted service to the people.
					
					 He was very pleased to learn that the branch provided a sure guarantee for rapidly developing agricultural production, pomiculture and foodstuff industry.
					
					 In order to effect a new turn in the development of the nation's bioengineering, it is necessary to provide sufficient conditions for scientific researches and pay deep attention to the living of scientists and technicians, he said, showing great loving care and benevolence for them.
					
					Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, set forth the tasks facing the branch.
					
					 Noting that it is very important for improving the people's standard of living to develop bioengineering, he underscored the need to decisively develop the bioengineering for the purpose of making a new revolution in different fields including agriculture, medical science, food industry, energy and environment. 
					
					 The branch should continue to conduct brisk scientific researches conducive to promoting people's health and fully displaying the advantages of the socialist public health system in the DPRK, he said, adding: It should also conduct in a bold and big way the work to cultivate more species of high-yielding crops and the projects to develop environment-friendly bio-energy and obtain rich resources from sea. 
					
					 He was accompanied by Choe Thae Bok, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK, Thae Jong Su, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK, and Mun Kyong Dok, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK and chief secretary of the Pyongyang City Committee of the WPK.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Visits Pyongyang Central Zoo
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Visits Pyongyang Central Zoo
Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il visited the Central Zoo in Pyongyang.
					He looked round the monument to President Kim Il Sung's on-site guidance newly built at the entrance of the zoo.
					
					Recalling the history of the zoo, he said that the zoo is a product of the President's warm love for the people. The undying feats of the President who devoted all his life to the people will shine long in the history of the country, he added.
					
					Going round a veterinary hospital, an aquarium and other places of the zoo, leader Kim Jong Il learned in detail about its management and operation.
					
					He expressed great satisfaction with the officials and employees of the zoo who have taken good care of animals and organized visits to the zoo in a meticulous way for the cultural and emotional education of the visitors.
					
					He set forth important tasks that would serve as guidelines in managing and operating the zoo.
					
					He called for increasing the number of animal species and laying a more solid material and technical foundation to spruce up the zoo in a promising way.
					
					To make more working people and school youth and children come to the zoo it is needed to provide sufficient services for them while furnishing the zoo to be convenient for their visits, he said. 
					
					He expressed belief that the employees of the zoo would creditably fulfill their mission and duty as servants for the people.
					
					Accompanying him were Mun Kyong Dok, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK and chief secretary of the Pyongyang City Committee of the WPK, Choe Thae Bok, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK, and Thae Jong Su, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Autograph to Discharged Soldiers
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Autograph to Discharged Soldiers 
 Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il sent autograph to 12 discharged soldiers who were dispatched to Jonchon County, Jagang Province in the northwestern part of the DPRK. It reads "I hope you will become excellent men of the country like the heroes of light comedy 'An Echo among the Hills.' Kim Jong Il 2011. 1. 18." 
					 They sent a letter to Kim Jong Il on Jan. 15. In the letter they expressed their resolution to become genuine masters of the native land and make it an ideal and beautiful village for the people by working hard in the soldier spirit like the hero of the light comedy "An Echo among the Hills." They also resolved themselves to fulfill their duty as patriotic farmers in the Songun era.

articles.title: Russian Official on Situation of Korean Peninsula
articles.content:
Russian Official on Situation of Korean Peninsula
 Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- Zhirinovsky, deputy speaker of the State Duma and chairman of the Liberal Democratic Party of Russia, released a statement over the situation of the Korean Peninsula on Jan. 13.
					 The statement said:
					
					 Korea remains the only divided country in the world.
					
					 The situation of the Korean Peninsula is still tense.
					
					 Korea's division into the north and the south was due to the interference of foreign forces.
					
					 Last year Koreans fully showed their desire for national reunification by significantly marking the 10th anniversary of the June 15 joint declaration and the 30th anniversary of the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo in the north and the south and abroad.
					
					 Their will to reunify the country independently is growing stronger with passage of time despite trials and ordeals.
					
					 Cooperation between the north and the south of Korea for peaceful reunification will be helpful to ensuring peace in Northeast Asia and denuclearizing the peninsula.
					
					 The DPRK has already and officially proposed to have dialogue without any precondition.
					
					 The authorities of south Korea should positively respond to this proposal.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Receives Credentials from WHO Representative
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Receives Credentials from WHO Representative
 Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister of the DPRK Pak Ui Chun Wednesday received credentials from Yonas Tegegen Woldemariam, representative of the World Health Organization here. 
					 After receiving credentials, he had a talk with the representative.

articles.title: Album Off Press
articles.content:
Album Off Press 
 Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- Album "Mt. Oga, Pride of Songun Korea" was brought out in the DPRK. 
					Carried in the first part of the album are a photograph of General Secretary Kim Jong Il visiting the mountain on July 1, 2008 and his proposition "Mt. Oga Nature Preservation Area is very wonderful."
					
					 Printed there are photographs "Respected Supreme Commander Comrade Kim Jong Il watching a pine-nut tree at the resting place on Mt. Oga ridge" and "Respected Supreme Commander Comrade Kim Jong Il watching main tree on Mt. Oga."
					
					 The album contains at least 400 photos showing fantastic sceneries in the area in four seasons. 
					
					 There are also photos showing the secret camp in Mopho Valley of the mountain and trees bearing slogans dating back to the period of the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle and a panoramic view of the area. 
					
					 Many photos on the album show hundreds of, more than a thousand years old rare natural plants, needle-leaf trees and broadleaf trees.

articles.title: Korean Students Enjoy Winter Vacation
articles.content:
Korean Students Enjoy Winter Vacation
 Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- All the students in the DPRK now enjoy their winter vacation. 
					 Their activities during vacation are diverse. They pursue study and physical training programs and learn how to play musical instruments. 
					
					 The libraries, schoolchildren's palaces, youth halls and schoolchildren's halls in various parts of the country are crowded with the students to acquire the general knowledge about basic science. 
					
					 Wi Kum Ran, a 21-year old girl student of Pyongyang Han Tok Su University of Light Industry, when interviewed by a reporter at the Grand People's Study House, said:
					
					 My goal during vacation is to read a lot of books on the subject in which I measure and conduct more researches. I will work hard to become a talent to serve the country.  
					
					 Ri Won Gyong, a 10-year old girl pupil of Pyongyang Munsin Primary School, was absorbed in the guitar practice at the Pyongyang Students and Children's Palace. "It is my wish to become a good guitarist," she said. 
					
					 It is the important programs of the students to visit museums, exhibitions, zoos, botanical gardens, scenic spots and historic sites.  
					
					 The playgrounds and parks are alive with students playing football, basketball and volleyball and other sports and enjoying kite-flying and other folk games.

articles.title: Korean People's View of Life
articles.content:
Korean People's View of Life
Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il made public his famous work "Let Us Live Not Merely for Today but for Tomorrow" in January 1996.
					 The work clarifies the view of life to be possessed by the Korean people and principled matters arising in having a true view of life. 
					
					 It is the idea of the work that one should devote oneself to the future of the country and the happiness of the generations to come, though one does not enjoy pleasure. 
					
					 The work calls for always living and working in an optimistic way full of the firm conviction of victory. 
					
					 The ideas and theories expounded in the work serve as guidelines for the Korean people to make their life worthwhile. 
					
					 Regarding the noble ideas of the work as a maxim of life, the service personnel and people of the DPRK are bringing about a decisive turn in building a great, prosperous and powerful nation. 
					
					 Last year all the people worked with redoubled efforts to put into practice the call of the Workers' Party of Korea for channeling everything into the drive for improving the people's standard of living, putting various sectors like light, chemical and metal industries on a higher level. 
					
					 Such achievements are the shining fruition of the Korean people's genuine view of life, traits and work style aimed to bring a rosy future.

articles.title: US Urged to Make Switchover to Dialogue and Fence Mending
articles.content:
US Urged to Make Switchover to Dialogue and Fence Mending 
Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- If the confrontation forces are to avoid a war and ensure co-existence, co-prosperity and common interests, they should pay primary attention to peace and seek ways of ensuring it, said Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a bylined article.
					 It is an important requirement for ensuring peace at present to attach importance to dialogue and negotiations and strive to mend fences, the article noted, and went on:
					
					 If dialogue and negotiations are to make smooth progress, there should be will to improve the relations. 
					
					 Last year the United States more zealously pursued confrontation and war on the Korean Peninsula and the rest of Northeast Asia than dialogue and negotiations and the process to mend the relations. To this end, the U.S. worked hard to boost the U.S.-Japan-south Korea triangular military alliance and create environment favorable for laying a siege to Northeast Asia, etc. in a bid to meet its interests.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to reexamine its hostile policy toward the DPRK and make a U-turn towards dialogue and fence mending. 
					
					 It is the basic policy for ensuring peace to reject the imperialists' high-handed and arbitrary practices and foil their policy of strength.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists' pursuance of their policy of strength did not lead to the outbreak of the second Korean war because the DPRK has steadily implemented the Songun line. 
					
					 It is the desire and goal of the DPRK to ensure durable peace.
					
					 The Korean people will continue waging a dynamic struggle to prevent a war and preserve peace under the banner of independence, peace and friendship.

articles.title: US Forces Commander's Anti-DPRK Remarks Denounced in S. Korea
articles.content:
US Forces Commander's Anti-DPRK Remarks Denounced in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- The commander of the U.S. forces in south Korea in a recent radio appearance made remarks provoking the DPRK, according to a spokesman for the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea.
					 His remarks show that the U.S. is utterly indifferent to peace on the Korean Peninsula, the spokesman said in a commentary on Jan. 14 in which he demanded the U.S. repeal its policy towards the DPRK.
					
					 Military tie-up being stepped up among the U.S., Japan and south Korea is aimed to round off the preparations for a war against the DPRK and maintain the U.S. military supremacy, the commentary said.

articles.title: Chief of S. Korean Human Rights Committee Urged to Resign
articles.content:
Chief of S. Korean Human Rights Committee Urged to Resign
 Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity against Discrimination of the Handicapped in south Korea urged Hyon Pyong Chol, chairman of the Human Rights Committee, to resign.
					 At a press conference in Seoul on Jan. 14 the organization revealed he egged the police on to punish under criminal law its members who tried to get the bill on support for the activities of the handicapped enacted.
					
					 Greatly enraged at it, the organization vowed to wage an action till he steps down.

articles.title: S. Korea Urged to Respond to DPRK-proposed Dialogue
articles.content:
S. Korea Urged to Respond to DPRK-proposed Dialogue
 Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- Overseas Koreans organizations urged the authorities of south Korea to affirmatively respond to the DPRK's proposal for dialogue.
					 The United Confederation of Koreans in Kamchatka Territory of Russia in a statement on Jan. 12 demanded that the south Korean authorities promptly drop their policy for confrontation with the DPRK. 
					
					 The relations between the north and the south of Korea, which had favorably developed after the publication of the June 15 joint declaration, have grown worst and the situation been driven to the brink of war, the statement noted, adding: It is entirely due to the confrontation policy of the present south Korean authorities.
					
					 The United Confederation of Koreans in Kyrgyzstan said in a statement on Jan. 15 that the DPRK's proposal to have wide-ranging dialogue and negotiations with political parties and organizations including the authorities of south Korea is the most realistic way. 
					
					 All Koreans in Kyrgyzstan will work hard to implement the joint statement of the DPRK government, political parties and organizations, it said.

articles.title: Russians Express Support for DPRK
articles.content:
Russians Express Support for DPRK
 Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- Political parties and organizations of Russia expressed full support for the joint statement of the government, political parties and organizations of the DPRK.
					 The Executive Committee of the Party for Peace and Unity of Russia in a statement on Jan. 13 expressed steadfast support for the DPRK aspiring after peace and stability.
					
					 The only solution is for the north and the south of Korea to terminate their confrontation through dialogue, it said, adding: There is no other way for settling the complexity of their relationship and preventing unpredictable consequences.
					
					 The Party for Peace and Unity of Russia hopes that the situation of Northeast Asia would become stable as early as possible and affirms its support for the DPRK and its people, the statement declared.
					
					 The Maritime Territorial Regional Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation in a statement on the same day said that the joint statement conforms with the hope and desire of not only the Korean people but also world peace-loving forces. And it urged the south Korean authorities to accept it with sincerity.
					
					 The Far Eastern Association for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Songun Policy of Russia in a statement on Jan. 12 appealed to the international community to actively back the DPRK's proposals for peace.
					
					 Dialogue and negotiations are the only way for tiding over the difficult situation of the Korean Peninsula, said the Study Association on the DPRK of the Asia-Africa Institute under Moscow State University in a statement that day.

articles.title: Mexican Political Figure Hails DPRK Proposal
articles.content:
Mexican Political Figure Hails DPRK Proposal
 Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- The National Coordinating Committee of the Workers' Party of Mexico on Jan. 11 gave a lecture on the joint New Year editorial and the joint statement of the government, political parties and organizations of the DPRK.
					 Alberto Anaya Gutierrez, coordinator of the Committee, said in the lecture that they are sure that the Korean people will effect a decisive turn in improving the people's standard of living and building a thriving nation this year through the dynamic advance for a great surge.
					
					 We also hope that they will make big strides in the drive for the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea and the global independence, he said.
					
					 The Workers' Party of Mexico fully supports the important proposal the government, political parties and organizations of the DPRK solemnly made to their south Korean counterparts, out of the patriotic will to usher in a new decade of independent reunification, peace and prosperity, he declared.

articles.title: Int'l Body Calls for Solidarity with DPRK Joint Statement
articles.content:
Int'l Body Calls for Solidarity with DPRK Joint Statement
 Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- A leading official of an international body called on governments, progressive political parties and social organizations of all countries to express full solidarity with the joint statement of the DPRK government, political parties and organizations.
					 S. N. Sserwanga, secretary general of the African Regional Committee of Friendship and Solidarity with the Korean People, made this appeal in his statement Jan. 13.
					
					 The DPRK joint statement is a timely, reasonable and just proposal, he said.
					
					 No other region in the world remains so tense as the Korean Peninsula does, he said, adding: This is attributable to the lasting hostile relations between the DPRK and the U.S. and the persistent confrontation between the north and the south of Korea.
					
					 The DPRK made a bold proposal out of the desire to open a turning phase for peace and reunification of the peninsula, he said.

articles.title: Czech Organizations Urge S. Korea to Accept DPRK Proposal
articles.content:
Czech Organizations Urge S. Korea to Accept DPRK Proposal
 Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- Two Czech organizations urged the south Korean authorities to accept the DPRK's landmark proposal.
					 The Paektusan Czech-Korean Friendship Association and the Czech Group for the Study and Materialization of the Juche Idea in a joint statement on Jan. 12 said the proposal is the just one reflecting the requirement of the prevailing situation and the mission and responsibility of the Koreans before the times and the nation.
					
					 The proposal is another important initiative to avert the danger of a war on the Korean Peninsula and realize the ardent desire of the Koreans for its reunification, said the statement.
					
					 History shows that confrontation can never help settle the issue of the north-south relations but will spark armed conflict and war only, it said. In case another war breaks out on the peninsula, the Koreans will fall victim to it and foreign forces will fish in troubled waters, it added.

articles.title: Anniversary of KPA Supreme Commander Celebrated in 60 Countries
articles.content:
Anniversary of KPA Supreme Commander Celebrated in 60 Countries
Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- At least 60 countries and regions celebrated the 19th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's gaining of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army. 
					 Political parties, organizations and personages of different strata published statements to congratulate Kim Jong Il and praise his Songun leadership feats. They include the chairman of the Central Executive Committee of the Bangladesh National Socialist Party, chairman of the Communist Workers' Party of Finland for Peace and Socialism, the chairman of the Friendship Society Norway-Korea and British organizations of friendship and for the study of the Juche idea.
					
					 Celebrations were held by political parties, organizations and regional bodies. They include the Union Solidarity and Development Party of Myanmar, Genuine Lumumbist Patriotic Party of Democratic Congo, Communist Party in Sweden, the Secretariat of the Pan-African Movement, the International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions. 
					
					 Articles hailing Kim Jong Il were edited in bulletins and posted on Internet homepages by political parties and organizations of different countries and regional and international organizations. They include the Brazilian Communist Party, Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy, the Bulgaria-Korea Friendship Association, the Asian Regional Institute of the Juche Idea and the Korean Friendship Association headquartered in Spain.

articles.title: Red-letter Days of DPRK to Be Marked in Pakistan
articles.content:
Red-letter Days of DPRK to Be Marked in Pakistan
 Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- A Pakistani preparatory committee was formed in Karachi on Jan. 10 to commemorate the Day of the Sun, the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung, and February 16, the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 The deputy speaker of the Assembly of Sind State was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to hold seminar, film show, photo exhibition and other political and cultural events from February to April.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il dirige la filial de biotecnologia de academia de ciencias
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il dirige la filial de biotecnologia de academia de ciencias
						
Pyongyang, 19 de enero (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, dirigio sobre el terreno la Filial de Biotecnologia de la Academia Estatal de Ciencias que avanza a galopes hacia la cima de ciencias y tecnicas.
					  El Dirigente averiguo en detalles el estado de investigacion cientifica recorriendo largamente varios lugares de la filial como la exposicion de exitos de investigacion cientifica, la sala de aplicacion en la produccion del proceso intermedio de productos biologicos, la sala de estudio de genoma, la de cultivo del tejido de vegetales, la de estudio de celulas troncales y la de investigacion de vegetales transgenicos.
					
					  Los cientificos y tecnicos de la filial descubrieron las causas de varias epidemias con el metodo biotecnologico y desarrollaron las medicinas y vacunas para tratar las enfermedades dificilmente curables, dijo y prosiguio que ellos sentaron asi la firme base cientifica y tecnica para contribuir al fomento de la salud del pueblo.
					
					  Esto es un gran exito, apunto y aprecio altamente la disposicion de ellos de servir abnegadamente al pueblo.
					
					  Se mostro muy contento de que la filial haya procurado la garantia para desarrollar vertiginosamente la agricultura, la fruticultura y la industria alimentaria.
					
					  Para producir un nuevo cambio en el desarrollo de la biotecnologia nacional, se debe facilitar en lo suficiente las condiciones necesarias a la investigacion cientifica y prestar profunda atencion a la vida de cientificos y tecnicos, enseno y dispenso grandes benevolencias para ellos. 
					
					  Presento las tareas que incumben a la filial. 
					
					  Senalo que desarrollar la biotecnologia es muy importante para mejorar las condiciones de la vida del pueblo.
					
					Volvio a destacar la necesidad de desarrollar decisivamente esa rama para producir una nueva revolucion en la agricultura, la medicina, la industria alimentaria, la energia, la proteccion medioambiental y otras esferas.
					
					  Subrayo que la filial debe seguir impulsando energicamente los proyectos de investigacion cientifica que contribuyan al fomento de salud publica de los hombres y al aumento de las ventajas del sistema sanitario socialista de Corea.
					
					  Ademas, tiene que trabajar con osadia para cultivar muchas variedades de plantas agricolas de alto rendimiento y mucha calidad y obtener la bio-energia, que no contamina el medio ambiente, y abundantes recursos provenientes del mar, preciso.
					
					  Le acompanaron en esta ocasion Choe Thae Bok, miembro del Buro Politico y secretario del CC del PTC, Thae Jong Su, miembro suplente del BP y secretario del CC del PTC, y Mun Kyong Dok, miembro suplente del BP y secretario del CC del PTC y secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la Ciudad de Pyongyang.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il dirige en el terreno el Parque Zoologico Nacional
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il dirige en el terreno el Parque Zoologico Nacional
						
Pyongyang, 19 de enero (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, realizo la visita de orientacion al Parque Zoologico Nacional.
					  Ante todo, recorrio el monumento a la direccion en el terreno del Presidente Kim Il Sung construido nuevamente a la entrada del parque.
					
					  Al recordar con emocion la orgullosa trayectoria del zoo-parque, dijo que este lugar es un producto del gran amor del Presidente por el pueblo y agrego que se registraran para siempre en los anales de la patria las imborrables proezas revolucionarias de el que vivio toda su vida para el pueblo.
					
					  Acto seguido, estuvo en varios lugares como el hospital veterinario nuevamente construido, el acuario y el establo de muestra de las habilidades de animales, donde averiguo en detalles el estado de administracion y operacion.
					
					  Se mostro muy complacido de que los funcionarios y empleados del zoologico dieran educacion cultural a muchos visitantes protegiendo bien a los animales y organizando esmeradamente el programa de visita.
					
					  Luego, presento las tareas programaticas que serviran de guia en la administracion del parque zoologico.
					
					  Para acondicionar mejor este parque con vistas al futuro, hay que aumentar las especies de animales y consolidar la base material y tecnica, apunto.
					
					  Es preciso acondicionar el interior y el exterior de las jaulas con el fin de facilitar la visita y construir suficientes establecimientos de descanso, de modo que mayor numero de trabajadores, jovenes y ninos puedan pasar aqui los ratos de vida cultural, enseno.
					
					  Finalmente, expuso la esperanza y conviccion de que los empleados del parque cumpliran magnificamente su honrosa mision y deber como servidores al pueblo.
					
					  Acompanaron al Dirigente en esta ocasion Mun Kyong Dok, miembro suplente del Buro Politico y secretario del CC del PTC y secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la Ciudad de Pyongyang, Choe Thae Bok, miembro del BP y secretario del CC del PTC, y Thae Jong Su, miembro suplente del BP y secretario del CC del PTC.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il pone firma en la carta de 12 militares licenciados
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il pone firma en la carta de 12 militares licenciados
Pyongyang, 19 de enero (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il leyo la carta que le escribieron 12 militares licenciados enviados al distrito de Jonchon de la provincia de Jagang y la firmo asi: "Deseo que ustedes sean trabajadores pilares del pais como los protagonistas de Eco de la Montana. Kim Jong Il 18 de enero de 2011".
					En su carta fechada 15, los remitentes expresaron su decision de cumplir la mision de campesinos patrioticos de la epoca del Songun, al formarse como verdaderos duenos de la tierra natal que sepan convertirla en el paraiso del pueblo con el temperamento de los militares siguiendo el ejemplo del protagonista de la comedia ligera Eco de la Montana.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun recibe cartas credenciales del delegado de OMS
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun recibe cartas credenciales del delegado de OMS
						
  Pyongyang, 19 de enero (ATCC) -- El representante de la Organizacion Mundial de la Salud (OMS) en Corea, Yonas Tegegen Woldemariam, entrego el dia 19 sus cartas credenciales al canciller coreano Pak Ui Chun. 
					  Tras recibirlas, Pak departio con el representante.
